text: A large empty coach, all dull beige seats and wood veneer makes its way along a stretch of motorway.

At the back of the coach we see a lone passenger. His eye closed, head drooped. Suddenly he raises a hand and rubs bridge of his nose. It's no use, Chris, 25, can't sleep. pulls up a set of head phones, puts them on, and presses on his MP3.

Long shot from the front of the coach, the driver's gruff face to the left, empty seats filtering away from camera, Chris' head peaking above a back seat. We hear the music from his MP3 begin to play. It's Noel McKoy's "Brighter D a northern soul track that's reminiscent of Motown and comparable to the vocal sound of Marvin Gaye. The track will play over the following opening scenes, th credits fading subtly in and out in white text.
We follow from behind as a hooded character walks with in through Dudlowe: a sprawling new town built in the fiftie house the east end after the Second World War.
We reveal Shifty, 25, Pakistani, as he makes his way thro those morning streets. He blows on his hands to warm them
Suddenly he ducks down and nips through an opening in a fence, making a short cut.
Bird's eye view on Trevor Perry, average looking, thickse pallid skin, lying beneath the surface of the bath water, holding his nose.

head_text.subj: CALM, UNNATURAL ALMOST. SNOT RUNS FROM HIS NOSTRILS.

text: Chris stares out of the window. The music still playing o his MP3. The coach makes a sharp left turn, the camera ju catching a glimpse of the sign: DUDLOWE NEW TOWN.
Glen, a severe almost cruel face, empty's about a kilo of cocaine onto a clean glass table.
Jasmine, 25, pretty with out make up, dressed in a white dressing gown, prepares breakfast.
Shifty makes his way across a patch of waste land, jumpin over a fence at the end.
Suddenly Jasmine lurches toward the sink and vomits.

text: In an agreeably decorated bedroom Trevor dresses for work climbs into his thick checked shirt and jeans, no real enthusiasm - life seems to hold no motivation.
Chris watches out the window as the coach passes the same strip of waste land Shifty just walked across.
Glen splits the cocaine into two piles.
Trevor sits on the edge of the bed, staring at the floor. mind is racing, thinking about the morning ahead of him.
Jasmine washes away the sick with a jug of water.
The coach pulls away to reveal Chris, his bag slung over shoulder. A BEAT. He turns and walks off.
Trevor looks at him self in the bathroom mirror, he rubs face, he seems a little more with it.
Glen opens a tub of Glucose and empties a measure into on half of the cocaine. He mixes it carefully.

Shifty stands at the table sorting through letters. He he the knock and walks to open it. He takes off his jacket, it on a hanger and opens the front door to reveal Chris.

Yes, rude boy.

I'm sweet... come in, man, come in. Shifty and Chris embrace.
Good to see you, mate.
Good to see you too, geezer.
